byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Diyala Province, Iraq.
byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and ANNE BARNARD

abstract: Islamic State claims responsibility for bombing that killed at least 100 people at marketplace in Khan Bani Saad, town in eastern Iraq.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State group has claimed responsibility for a bombing in eastern Iraq, as Iraqi officials on Saturday said that the death toll had risen to 100 people killed, with 20 more missing and more than 100 wounded.

headline.main: ISIS Says It Carried Out Bombing That Killed 100 in Iraq
headline.print_headline: ISIS Says It Carried Out Bombing That Killed 100 in Iraq

snippet: The Islamic State group has claimed responsibility for a bombing in eastern Iraq, as Iraqi officials on Saturday said that the death toll had risen to 100 people killed, with 20 more missing and more than 100 wounded.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
